t: The*p oracle concerning Moab. Surely*pn in a night Ar of Moab is devastated and*i ruined; Surely*ln in a night Kir of Moab is devastated and*i ruined.
They*ln have gone up to the temple and to*i Dibon, even*i to the high places to weep. Moab*ln wails over Nebo and Medeba; Everyoneâ€™s*ln head is bald and*i every beard is cut off.
In*ln their streets they have girded themselves with sackcloth; On*ln their housetops and in their squares Everyone*ln is wailing, dissolved in tears.
Heshbon*ln and Elealeh also cry out, Their*ln voice is heard all the way to Jahaz; Therefore*ln the armed men of Moab cry aloud; His*ln soul trembles within him.

My*ln heart cries out for Moab; His*ln fugitives are as far as Zoar and*i Eglath-shelishiyah, For*ln they go up the ascent of Luhith weeping; Surely*ln on the road to Horonaim they raise a cry of distress over their*i ruin.
For*ln the waters of Nimrim are desolate. Surely*ln the grass is withered, the tender grass died out, There*ln is no green thing.
Therefore*ln the abundance which*i they have acquired and stored up They*ln carry off over the brook of Arabim.
For*ln the cry of distress has gone around the territory of Moab, Its*ln wail goes*i as far as Eglaim and its wailing even to Beer-elim.
For*ln the waters of Dimon are full of blood; Surely*ln I will bring added woes*i upon Dimon, A*ln lion upon the fugitives of Moab and upon the remnant of the land.
